alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Henry; Obion; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:43AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Weakley, northeastern Gibson, eastern Obion and southwestern Henry Counties through 1115 AM CDT... At 1043 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kenton, or 7 miles southwest of Martin, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Martin, Union City, McKenzie, Fulton, Dresden, South Fulton, Dyer, Greenfield, Gleason, Kenton, Rutherford, Bradford, Sharon, Latham, Rives, Sandhill, Mount Pelia, Good Luck, Ruthville and Como. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
